title: Substitute
text: Start from inside and build out: what is g(h(x))?

title: Substitute
text: Plug in h(x) for $$x$$ in g(x): $$g(h(x))=\sqrt{x}-6$$

title: Substitute
text: Now plug in $$g(h(x))=\sqrt{x}-6$$ for $$x$$ in f(x): $$f(g(h(x)))=\left(\sqrt{x}-6\right)^4+6$$

title: Simplify
text: $$\left(\sqrt{x}-6\right)^4+6$$ is a good enough final answer (distributing is messy), so $$f(g(h(x)))=\left(\sqrt{x}-6\right)^4+6$$ is our final answer.
